title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7904.2 - Timeliness of State action
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7904.2 - Timeliness of State action

State Regulations
(a) If
the State Energy Office fails to take action on an application within 15
business days of filing (if the action is initially filed orally, it shall be
considered to be filed on the date that it is orally communicated to the State

Energy Office), the applicant may treat the application as having been denied
in all respects and may appeal therefrom as provided in this part. (b) Notwithstanding paragraph (a) of this
section, if a County Energy Coordinator or the State Energy Office dismisses an
application without prejudice for insufficient information under section
7901.6
(c) of this
subchapter, or if an applicant making an oral request fails to file a written
application within five days as required by section
7901.4
(a) of this
subchapter, the running of the fifteen-day period shall be suspended until the
application is resubmitted with sufficient information or the written
application is filed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7904.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
